creator: anjum@131walsingham.freeserve.co.uk
text:
I cannot run Tomcat as an NT Service using Personal Web Server (PWS). I have 
performed the following steps:
1. Downloaded jk_nt_service.exe
2. Edited wrapper.properties by setting the following values:
      wrapper.tomcat_home=d:\tomcat\jakart~1.1
      wrapper.java_home=g:\bin\jdk1.3.0
3. Installed the service as:
      jk_nt_service -i Jakarta wrapper.properties
   This gave the output:
      Asked (and given) winsock 1.1
      The service named Jakarta was created. Now adding registry entries
      Registry values were added
      If you have already updated wrapper.properties you may start the Jakarta
      service by executing "net start Jakarta" from the command prompt
4. Started the service as:
      net start Jakarta
   This gave the output:
      The Jakarta service is starting.
      The Jakarta service could not be started.
      The service did not report an error.
      More help is available by typing NET HELPMSG 3534.
5. Tried starting the service from Control Panel->Services and got a message 
with:
      Could not start the Jakarta service on <my machine name>
      Error 2140: An internal Windows NT error occured.

Please help.

creator: anjum@131walsingham.freeserve.co.uk
text:
I managed to fix it. It seems that it works if I move the JDK installation to a 
local drive rather than a network drive (G:) as I had done initially.
